entries.title: Handball World Championship: Denmark defeats France in final
entries.description: The Danish victory over the Olympic champions gives them a record three consecutive victories in the leading international handball event, which is held every two years.

entries.title: Most Tunisian voters shun parliamentary elections runoff
entries.description: The low turnout –  11.3% of Tunisia's 8 million voters – casts doubt on the future parliament's legitimacy and could complicate Saied's plans. Official preliminary results are expected to be announced Wednesday.

entries.title: 'For many trans people, transphobia is so common and so severe that the experience of it is total'
entries.description: The growing visibility of trans people in public space does not mean that the number of trans people is increasing, explains gender sociologist Arnaud Alessandrin, adding that discrimination is still an issue.

entries.title: The rise of sensitivity readers in the literary world: A sign of inclusivity or a threat to free speech?
entries.description: This new kind of proofreader focuses on ethnic, sexual and cultural prejudices in English-language manuscripts. The profession is having a tentative breakthrough in France.

entries.title: French PM says pension age hike 'non-negotiable' ahead of second major day of strikes
entries.description: The PM said raising the age to 64was 'non-negotiable' as France faces for another major day of protest and strikes on Tuesday.

entries.title: The US is fighting the other 'war' against Russia through offshore accounts, villas and yachts
entries.description: A task force set up by the US Department of Justice tracks down assets belonging to Russian individuals and entities targeted by the government.

entries.title: In India, the Bhima Koregaon case hinges on fabricated guilt
entries.description: Sixteen prominent intellectuals and activists, defenders of minorities and lower castes, are languishing in prison on the basis of manufactured allegations.

entries.title: Djokovic beats Tsitsipas to win 10th Australian Open title, 22nd Grand Slam
entries.description: The Serbian champion has now equalled Rafael Nadal's record of 22 Grand Slam titles.

entries.title: Cate Blanchett, a maestro in full control of her art
entries.description: Recognized as one of the best actresses of her generation, at 53 the Australian plays one of the most outstanding roles of her career with 'Tár.' The film could earn the actress a third Oscar, after awards at Venice and the Golden Globes.

entries.title: Czech Republic: Petr Pavel's election brings back a pro-European moderate to the presidency
entries.description: The former chief of staff will succeed the pro-Russian and eurosceptic Milos Zeman. With more than 58% of the vote, Petr Pavel won a landslide victory over  populist former prime minister, Andrej Babis.

entries.title: UK Conservative Party chair Zahawi sacked by Sunak after tax row
entries.description: The former chancellor has faced extensive questions in parliament and the media after it emerged he agreed to pay millions in a settlement with the tax department.

entries.title: Pension reform: Why the equation is getting more complicated for the government
entries.description: Public opinion is getting irritated, support is eroding among MPs and concessions are rare. The French government is facing several difficulties in getting its contested reform project approved.

entries.title: 2024 Olympics speed up northeast Paris renewal
entries.description: The only large-scale facility to be built within Paris premises for the Olympics, an arena, will be in the surroundings of the Porte de La Chapelle, a deprived area of the capital.

entries.title: Pakistan: More than 50 killed in separate transport accidents
entries.description: Rescue workers raced to the sites of two devastating accidents on Sunday, after a bus fell into a ravine and a boat carrying children capsized.

entries.title: 'The ‘Shiite crescent’ of Lebanon, Syria and Iraq is at risk of crumbling'
entries.description: Antoine Basbous, a specialist of the Arab world, says that Beirut, Damascus and Baghdad are sinking further into crisis due to the scarcity of the dollar, institutional chaos, economic disorder and civil war.

entries.title: To all the overwhelmed mothers out there, take a break and watch Jacinda Ardern
entries.description: In a poignant speech, New Zealand's prime minister announced that she was resigning to 'spend time with her family.'

entries.title: Lebanon: The investigation into the Beirut port explosion turns into a judicial battle
entries.description: Judge Tarek Bitar reopened the investigation on Monday after a 13-month standoff. Public prosecutor Ghassan Oueidate charged him in return for "rebellion against justice" and 'usurpation of power,' and released the seventeen detainees.

entries.title: Israeli government to revoke rights of 'terrorist families'
entries.description: The measure was announced after two attacks in east Jerusalem, one of which killed seven people near a synagogue.

entries.title: Iran reports a drone attack on a military site
entries.description: The defense ministry, quoted by the IRNA news agency, said it had repelled a drone attack on a military site in central Isfahan province.

entries.title: Guitarist Tom Verlaine, co-founder of Television, dies at 73
entries.description: The singer and musician influenced many while playing at New York music venue CBGB alongside the Ramones, Patti Smith and Talking Heads.
